article_text: “Do you have sports clothes?” and “Do you have Nike?” “They all could ask me if I had blue jeans,” he said. “I sold a pair. I needed the money.” The incident he mentioned involved a woman in the hotel where he was staying. She dragged him into a dark room, he said, where they haggled over the price for a pair of Levi’s. Flatley sold them to her for $40. “I could have gotten $50, but I would have felt too guilty.” Aside from typical blue jean-centered conversations, Flatley noticed that people of different age groups reacted to him dif-
